data.title: Sunday morning breakfast
data.text: Such an eccentric place to have Sunday morning brunch. The wait staff are very friendly and helpful. The Bloody Mary is rated #1 in my book and get yourself a cranberry mimosa if you're not a Bloody Mary fan. The smashed avocado and tomato toast is beyond words. Take a trip today for and experience you'll be putting in your "let's do again" book.

data.title: Nightmare Brunch
data.text: Came here for Brunch this morning with my husband and mother.  Got a table without a wait, server took our orders and 45 minutes later we still did not have our food!  Terrible service and kitchen not at all able to keep up with the orders.  After 45 minutes server came over and asked my husband how he wanted his eggs - are you kidding?? After 50 minutes my husband received his sandwich and was half finished while my mom and I still had not received our food! We walked out at that point, should have left sooner!  Don't go here on a Sunday!!! We won't be going back again on any day!!

data.title: Don't go Thurs., out of many foods
data.text: Apparently we didn't catch them at their best. It seems there supply truck comes Fri. so they were out of lamb and many ingredients to make salads etc. We arrived around 1:30 to beat lunch rush which we did, but alas they were out of several ingredients. The bloody Abilene was very good though a bit small & my bacon sandwich was good. My wife's burger had zero salt or seasoning & the fries were double salted. Speaking of fries, my truffle fries arrived in time for desert. What gives with that. The cocktail and the homemade ketchup were the best things we had. We really went for the lamb so kind of a bummer from the get go. Maybe we will try one more time & at evening instead of lunch. Hopefully they will have more options & be on the ball. Had high hopes for this place & I was disappointed..

data.title: Busy but good
data.text: I took my 2 children downtown and we stumbled upon this place. They've never had brunch so we thought we'd give it a shot.  Initially we were sitting outside because they were so packed but once another family left we asked to go inside and they were willing to accomodate that.  I sincerely appreciated that because my youngest was feeling pretty sick from the heat.  They were out of a couple items on the menu (had run out) but it was diverse enough we were able to make other selections without feeling like we were missing out.  The food came out as it was completed which was actually nice because it felt like we were having courses- we all tried each other's food and all of it was great.  I'd recommend the biscuits and gravy all day. I'd return to this place but probably with my husband and not with the kids.  I also wish the inside was a little larger.  It was pretty cramped and popular which is great for business but a little overwhelming if you aren't into large crowds.

data.title: Nice but noisy
data.text: Our food & drinks were good . They left a lot of fat on my duck.. Would have been nice if they removed it.. Didnt notice it before I put 2 different bites in my mouth.

data.title: Funky little place
data.text: We were traveling to West Texas, and stopped here for lunch.  Abilene is a pretty small town, we weren't expecting much but this place is freaking awesome. I had the duck hash. Read that again, duck hash. It was outrageous. My wife had the shrimp and grits. She gave me a bite of hers. It was fantastic, I didn't give her any of mine. This place is three hours from my home but I'll be back.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Found this diamond in the rough.  Very trendy, great beer.  Chef did agree at job on desserts and our salad rocked!  Kids loved it.  Such a cute place and hip.  So glad we took a chance!

data.title: Delicious and cozy!
data.text:
Everything I have ordered has the best flavors, from their fries to the pasta salad.
Has great drinks at the bar and fantastic desserts!

data.title: Not a bad little place. Could be better.
data.text:
I really, really want to love this place. It's definitely not what you think of when you think of Abilene. But...

Food: Hamburger with smoked Gouda, bacon and egg. 
Steak and frites. 
Let me first say that the food was tasty and worth the money. 
However, both meats were overcooked. We ordered medium and got Well and well done. Pretty unforgivable. 

Service: friendly and helpful. However, for a place with only 10 tables the wait staff was just not attentive. 

The building was air conditioned but still an uncomfortable 80+ deg in late June.

data.title: Making a good effort
data.text:
As far as the venue goes, there is nothing quite like it. I got a specialty burger that was phenomenal and my wife got fish that was very good. 

They have done the non-traditional "Hipster" type venue, so you are paying for great quality food, not so much for atmosphere. 

If this fits the scene you are looking for then there is nothing else like it in town.

data.title: Lots of Potential Here!
data.text:
Truffle fries: excellent, and would get again.
Scotch egg: tasty, but needed a hit of salt.
Abi-Burger: don't waste your time on this.  While the quality of meat is good, we ordered ours rare, and it came out well done.  The size of the patty was small and not representative of the usual Texas-oversized portions.  While the bun was tasty, it was way too big for the small patty.  If they could keep the beef, cook it correctly, and throw out the rest of the burger ingredients, it would be solid.
Smoked chicken & mash:  The mashed potatoes were excellent and well-seasoned.  The chicken was just okay.  Good, but not special.

Dessert:
The chocolate espresso pie was INCREDIBLE!  Whoever made this deserves a raise and their own restaurant/bakery.  I would travel to Abilene, just for that pie.  Flaky crust, creamy filling, delicious all the way down.  We even bought a second slice to take home.  You will love this.  Go just for the pie.

Beignets with Lemon Curd: Solid.  Fluffy, crunchy, warm and delicious.  The lemon curd is a bit sour and acidic, but that is probably due to the type of lemons they have access to in these parts.  Whoever does the desserts at this place, knows what they are doing.

Overall a good place to eat, but it feels like it is just a step away from greatness.  Fresh ingredients, lots of TLC put into their food, but a few tweaks away from providing an amazing experience.

data.title: Wonderful brunch
data.text: We came here on a Saturday morning for brunch.  I had a great Bloody Mary.  It is obviously a house made mix, and very tasty.  My wife are the egg sandwich and she said she loved it.  I had the pork belly "BLT" or as they called it PBAT.  It had a great flavor but was fattier than I prefer.  We will definitely be back.

data.title: Lack of transparency on the wine list
data.text: Meal was great, service was great, atmosphere is good, but a little loud. That's okay. But if you like wine more than beer, be clear on what the prices are on a glass of wine before you order as those are not listed on the menu ... and they should be, even if it's on a daily printout that accompanies the main menu or on that large, wall-sized chalkboard. $15 for a glass of decent wine is okay by Los Angeles standards, but unexpected and high for Abilene. I assumed I was ordering in the $9-$11 range in comparison with similar wines in other Abilene restaurants, so I didn't ask, which is partially my fault. But please be transparent about the prices of your wines by the glass, especially for the higher-priced varietals.

data.title: Sunday Brunch, good but not great
data.text: This restaurant is very small and we arrived a couple of minutes before it opened so we could get a table.  The place filled up quickly after they opened.  There seemed to be too many waiters and not enough cooks (the kitchen was tiny so they may not be able to add any additional people).  My french toast was good but not outstanding and my daughters egg sandwich seemed like a better choice.  It really did not seem to be "Brunch", just breakfast items or a couple types of burgers were available.

data.title: Was ok
data.text:
Now all this could have been the two times I was there. But the staff was rude, like "hostess" texting on her phone sipping on a Stripes drink, the waitress didn't know the menu at all. 
 The food was ok, nothing so great is go back for. It was like someone with minimal skills cooking to impress but over their head.

data.title: Don't subscribe  to the hype
data.text: This establishment in any other city would fail, period. The menu is limited. The service is typical of Abilene. Poor by any other environment.  If you are local, and this is all you know, so be it. If you're not from here, and you are considering parting with your hard earned here, caveat emptor. My wife and I were directed to sit outside on rickety hard wood seats. Then ignored. After 15 minutes, we pulled the plug.

data.title: Good local eats
data.text: If you're looking for the secret little place all the locals know about, then this is it. The food is always delicious, whether it's the $6 "cheap and cheesy" burger or one of their regularly changing specials ($20-30). They use interesting, farm-fresh ingredients and everything is always cooked perfectly. I also love their cocktail menu with unique twists on familiar favorites. It's a small restaurant with only about 8 tables, but they do call ahead and will even send you a text when you're table is ready so you can wait in the comfort of your own home.

data.title: Hidden gem in Abilene
data.text: Abi-Haus is a small restaurant so make sure to get there early for a table. The menu has a great variety of items including brunch. They offer fantastic burgers and you can get truffle oil on your fries. It does take a little too long to get your food, but it's always worth the wait.

data.title: Outstanding
data.text: The food, service, and ambiance was way better than I expected. We were seated right away and were treated extremely nice by our waitress, Cali. Food was very fresh and cooked perfectly, absolutely nothing to complain about.

data.title: Try this place, you won't regret it!
data.text: My partner and I have eaten here twice now, once for dinner and once for Sunday brunch.  Sit outside if you can...inside is a bit cramped and very loud.  Be prepared for a wait and plan accordingly, but you won't regret coming here.  The food is spectacular and not at all what I would expect to find in Abilene.  It's a welcome change from all the chains and greasy spoon places.
